sentence.Network_en: I gave him sixpence yesterday and advised him to save it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我昨天给了他六便士,并建议他把这点钱积存起来.

sentence.Network_en: Wages were sixpence a week within living memory.
sentence.Network_cn: 周工资为六便士的年代,人们记忆犹新.

sentence.Network_en: He took sixpence from the palm of her hand and went to the counter to pay.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从她手心里拿了六便士到柜台付了钱.

lj.lj_ly: the car stops on a sixpence.
lj.lj_ls: 这部车在很小的位置熟练地停了下来。

entry.tran: (1971 年前英国旧币制的)六便士
entry.def: A sixpence is a small silver coin which was used in Britain before the decimal money system was introduced in 1971. It was the equivalent of 2.5 pence.

means.word_mean: 1. a small coin of the United Kingdom worth six pennies; not minted since 1970
